meanings.definition: The absence or failure of milk secretion in the mammary glands.
meanings.sent1: After giving birth, the agalactias in some mothers can be distressing.
meanings.sent2: The vet diagnosed the cat with agalactias after she couldn't nurse her kittens.
meanings.sent3: The cow joked with the other animals, saying, 'I must have agalactias because my milk has gone on vacation!'
meanings.sent4: The barren field resembled the agalactias of a dry well, unable to produce any liquid.
meanings.sent5: The image of the withered plant served as a stark reminder of the agalactias in the garden.

meanings.definition: The condition of being unable to produce milk.
meanings.sent1: The agalactias in the new mother caused concern for her baby's nutrition.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper noticed the agalactias in the giraffe and provided special care.
meanings.sent3: The bakery ran out of milk, leading to an agalactias crisis for their famous pastries.
meanings.sent4: The river dried up, showing an agalactias similar to a lactose-intolerant cow.
meanings.sent5: The desert landscape mirrored the agalactias of a barren land, devoid of any liquid sustenance.
